Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: karema
Reviews.Content: It was really difficult to book a good clean hotel for smart price near Termini station. Medici hotel fullfilled all what other travellers already mentioned here. From Termini station it takes approximatelly 15 minutes by walk to get there, otherwise you can use bus nr. 75 for instance. The street where the hotel is located is nice, with some restaurants and shops around. Check in went really smoothly, what is funny, they still use the old keys ( kind of retro :-) and not the cards. Receptionist was really nice, explained us everything, checked for us the weather forecast. Wifi code is to be asked at the reception and is for free, however it works properly just in the reception and the lobby, in the rooms the signal may get lost. Room was clean, with own bathroom, hairdryer, amenities, minibar ( surprisingly the prices there were not overpriced), heater, aircondition, flat TV ( selection of channels not so great but who would watch TV in rome?) big wardrobe. The beds were not so comfortable, I did not like my pillow, however one may find it ok. All over the rooms and hotel have a touch of history, which you feel in Rome on every step you take. Lobby is great, with ancient sofas, statues, flowers, lamps and so on. Also you can enjoy a TV there. The hotel has also own garden, as it was raining we did not have chance to try it. Breakfast room is very basic as the whole breakfast is. As it is small it may get pretty busy in there. The pastries are great, selection of cheese and salamies is basic, yoghurts, cereals, butter and jam. Coffee and juices ok. I missed toast machine. All over, the hotel is a 3star standard, clean with walking distance to major attraction and definetely I would stay there again if travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sotiria T
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend for the New Years and we were quite satisfied. The location is excellent, it is very close to the Termini train station and there is a bus stop within 2 minutes. However, you will probably not need the bus, since most tourist attractions are within walking distance. We walked everywhere, we only took the bus to go to the Vatican. The staff were very friendly and polite, the breakfast was also good, basic but good. The only thing we didn't like was that the walls are not noise proof, exactly as others have said before me, we woke up in the middle of the night because a couple of girls were screaming at a nearby room... The rooms are not that big, but very clean. I didn't like the fact that the queen size bed were two twin beds put together though. I think it's a great choice if you're looking for good quality in an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: tom c
Reviews.Content: Location is fine, rooms are grand for the price, people at the desk are excellent, breakfast just adequate, but a fine base for a weekend visit...nice walk to Querenale district, and taxis are good value when ordered from the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 13Narya
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights at the beginning and end of our trip to Italy for sightseeing in Rome. The location is great for sightseeing in Rome, and many sights (Trevi fountain) are in walking distance. The hotel staff were very friendly helpful, and made great restaurant recommendations and also assisted with transportation arrangements, and sightseeing sggestions. All staff spoke English, which was helpful with my limited Italian. The room was comfortable, although our "queen" size bed was two twin beds pushed together. the bathrooms are small (this is Europe) and very clean. Breakfast is good, not great. There are a lot of choices (pastries,bread, cereal, yogurt, canned fruit, cheeses, coffee machine, teas) but it is not high-quality. However, for something quick it is sufficient. Breakfast is served in a downstairs cafeteria that can get quite busy. Overall, this is a great, affordable option when visiting Rome. If you are looking for luxory accomodations, this is not the place for you. If you are trying to balance cost, location and quality it is a great pick!

Reviews.Title: “It's a 3 star Hotel - Nothing more nothing less.”
Reviews.Author: LeahKeith
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in Medici for 5 nights over the Christmas/New Years holiday period with my partner. We are a couple in our early 30s from Ireland. This was our 3rd trip to Rome. We selected Medici on the basis of reviews on Trip Advisor. Positives: * 10 minute walk with luggage from termini. * Reasonable walking distance to most major sites. * Not far from 2 Metro Stations. * Staff were friendly and willing to accommodate your needs as best as possible. * Hotel was clean. * Coffee/cappuchino maker in breakast room. * A lovely little flower shop, pizza place La Biesta (I think) and a spice shop in the area. Negatives: * Reception area leads one to believe that the hotel is much grander than a 3 star but when you get to the rooms you realise it is very much 3 star. We had to change rooms 3 times before we were content to stay. Primarily based on how incredibly small and pokey the first 2 rooms where. * The walls are paper thin. On our last morning we were awoken by girls in the room next to us screaming at each other. We reported it to reception who called the room to address the issue but had to do so 3 times before it ceased. Other guests were also disturbed by the noise. Hotel staff were apologetic. * Decor in the room is dated and a bit of TLC could give the hotel a fresher more modern appearance in line with it's reception area. Overall, we could not fault Medici massively, it does exactly what it says on the tin - it was an average price for an average hotel. The hotel won't excite you but it will meet the basic needs of cleanliness, proximity, reasonable price and pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Erik S
Reviews.Content: This charming italian style hotel has a very nice downtown location on a tranquil street with a number of really good restaurants, wine bars and groceries/delicacy shops. Don´t miss to try for example the modern and trendy Marchetti wine bar or the nearby Ristorante La Locanda di Bacco both also at Via Flavia just two bocks away. At the same time it´s very near the more lively parts and in reach of both main attractions and communications. The staff is friendly and helpful, breakfast buffe is good value and the small bar and TV room as well as the free Internet Wi-Fi service are extra advantages. If you like jogging or running the Villa Borghese park is within easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “Little piece of heaven in "the eternal city"”
Reviews.Author: themurrays_11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Medici is truly a little piece of heaven in "the eternal city" with an outstandingly helpful and charming staff. Very comfortable room with huge, well-equipped bathroom. Lovely breakfast room with very good continental breakfast buffet which featured a coffee machine that produced excellent espresso, cappucino, machiato, americano cups of coffee with the push of a button. Beautiful little courtyard to sit and sip and chat. Excellent value and the kind of "can do" service that is so often missing in hotels and, indeed, in the service industry. You cannot go wrong if you select this peaceful boutique hotel for your "Roman holiday".

Reviews.Title: “They came through for us”
Reviews.Author: lindaannie
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers about friendly staff, great location (quiet, near Termini Station) and being more than 3 stars. In addition, the place was impeccably clean and the room came with free wifi. Best of all, was how they handled a problem for us. We asked them to call us a cab for the airport. Instead, they arranged for a private Mercedes to drive us, as they said that cabs sometimes charge extra fees inappropriately. Well, the driver took us to the wrong airport and when confronted, said it was our error and that to take us to the right airport would cost us 30,00euros more. We couldn't afford to miss our flight, and so we paid. I emailed the hotel about the problem and in less than 24 hours, they not only followed up to address the issue with the car service, but they refunded us the 30,00 euros. With that kind of response, and all the other good things about the hotel, we'll certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very friendly staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Galnev
Reviews.Content: It is better than a 3 star hotel. Situated in a perfect location. The breakfast was very good. - Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly good value Hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: viking_wanderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room which was clean and reasonably spacious. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the included breakfast tasty. The hotel is in a quiet location, but as with most of Rome, sadly, the streets are dirty and smelly, especially at the end of August.. But this obviously not under the control of the Hotel. It is located close enought to Termini to get to without a cab ride and to pick up tourist buses etc. Recommended for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mgabbor
Reviews.Content: Better than a usual 3 star hotel! Room was large, nice and quiet. The hotel is very close to the city centre and Termini station (5 minutes walk), and 20-30 min walk from the Colosseum. Located in a small street, no traffic, no noise. The breakfast was average. I had problem with wifi connection with my mobile.

Reviews.Title: “Think Carefully Before Booking this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: funhunter62
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth and front desk personnel were friendly. After a long flight and layover in London we were glad to reach Rome. Not as close as you might expect to the Termini Station. A 20 minute walk with Luggage. The area is somewhat dirty and rundown. It is a quiet street but most rooms face the courtyard and people stay out there drinking and talking loudly until 2:00AM. There were also people running up and down the halls. Bring your ear plugs!! When we checked out they stored our luggage so we could tour Rome for that day. We picked up our rental car and headed back to get our luggage. I went in and my husband stayed with the car since there is no parking near the hotel. I was given my suitcase and another suitcase that was black but with no tag on it.I asked for my other bag(we had checked 3)and he disappeared into the back. He finally returned with it and in the mean time I looked closely at what was supposed to be my husbands black bag. I opened it and it had a pair of dirty white tennis shoes in it and nothing else. When I told him it was not our bag ,he said it was. He then went to the back again and I followed him.The other bag was in plain sight with no other bags in sight. I sure hope this was a mistake since that bag was clearly marked. I would not stay there again. Many better opttions

Reviews.Title: “return stay & would stay again”
Reviews.Author: morewine3224
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel the first time based on trip advisor reviews and its relative easy access to the metro and bus transportation to all the sights, and I was not disappointed. This second stay was equally enjoyed. Free internet; free airport pickup when staying 3+ nights; the quaint, tucked away, narrow cobbelstone, quiet street location; the most friendly, helpful, English speaking front desk; a very enjoyable free buffet breakfast; absolutely charming common area; safe neighborhood; easy walk to the metro and bus system; very good Italian restaurants nearby; -- a gold mine based on the cost of the room. Sure the beds and pillows could be a little softer, and though the rooms are a little small (which seems to be the norm throughout Europe), my triple accomodations had more than enough room for me. My best to Dario and all the desk staff who helped make another enjoyable trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for..location, price, wonderful rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pizzsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a "comfortable" feel to it..clean rooms with everything you need and the price makes it worth your stay! The area is convenient to Termini (train station) and walking distance to Piazza Barberini, Via Veneto with an extra 20 min walk to the center of Rome..the staff is very friendly...We have stayed in Rome many times at another one of our favorite hotels but will add this one to our list as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Gamble to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: NonLoSo2011
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Rome on a long transatlantic flight I reserved a room here, and prepaid for it, based on some of the positive reviews here. Really bad. It is walkable from the Termini Centrale. But it's not the best neighborhood. I'm a relatively young and fit 200 pound male. Two guys stopped me near the hotel, demanding Euro's. I spend a lot of time in Italy, and frontal "mugging" attempts are rare. They didn't get anything. "Non parlo Italiano" stated sternly did the trick. Two streets later I arrived at the hotel. They said they had no reservation from me. Even after I showed them the confirmatory email with the confirmation number, the desk clerk really didn't care, and couldn't be bothered. I asked him to call someone who might know, but he wouldn't. I asked if I could get the password to use the wireless in the hotel lobby so that I could search for a room. Note, he kept telling me they had rooms, but they wanted me to pay again, even though I had a receipt and confirmation that I had already paid. They wouldn't let me use the lobby Wi-Fi. I wound up spending quite a bit on roaming charges using my US cell phone, something I would never web surf with in Europe. I found another hotel and arrived by about 9:00PM, wasting the evening. Now I have to figure out a way to get a refund from them. If I had the wife and family, it would have been a nightmare. It was a nightmare enough for me. No effort on their part to verify my confirmation number. Just that I pay them again to stay there that night.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel if you want to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: haaeen
Reviews.Content: My parents, husband and me spent 5 days in beautiful Rome and 4 nights in this hotel. The check in was quick and the receptionist was helpful. Our rooms were on first floor, next to the main door. The rooms and the bathrooms were clean but very small, especially the shower. The breakfast room looked like an old hospital room, but served a big selection of freshly baked danish pastries, croissants and all the food was tasty. We spent all our days with sightseeing and just returned to the hotel late in the evening for a good night sleep. And this is the point where the hotel let us down and made our stay at Hotel Medici a nightmare. Every single night from 1.30-2am a group of young people returned to the hotel and started to party in the corridor - they were singing, laughing, shouting and banging the doors. When I complained at 4am the receptionist sorted the problem and told me that he could see them in the cameras. So why he did not asked them to be quiet earlier? And the same scenario happened every night. This hotel could be a very good hotel but I would not stay here again and I would not recomment it to my friends. Lack of sleep can ruin even the best holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Took me ages to decide on a hotel and I got it right with the Medici!”
Reviews.Author: ELIZABETHMALLORCA
Reviews.Content: I was going to Rome for the first time with my daughter so I was being careful about the kind of area the hotel was in and being able to eat out at night without a trek! This hotel is very near to the main things we wanted to see such as the Trevi etc..We walked everywhere and it's true that you need to take your flat shoes ladies! The only thing that disappointed me in this fantastic place was how unfriendly the people are. Everything is so commercial that there are even guys outside every café or restaurant trying to get you in . I work in a hotel in Mallorca so it surprised me how distant the staff were in this hotel, it's as if the management have told them not to talk to us! The dining room staff acted as if there were no guests in the room. The cleaning of our room was without fault and thank you to the guy in the bar who was very nice to us. I would say that you have to be very careful not to be fooled. We arrived quite late and took a train to the Termini Station from the airport which cost around 20 euros. We got out onto the street and it was then dark so I knew that the hotel was not too far so we got in a taxi which took less than a minute to get to the hotel and he charged us 28 euros!!!!!!! for a journey that should have not been more than 7 or 8 euros........be warned this was our first hard lesson......not a great welcome.Note the number of the taxi if you use one to complain after if you feel robbed!! Lovely, amazing place . We felt safe always ( except when trying to cross a road!) Slept well in the hotel and ate a normal breakfast. It is just a shame that being such a small hotel, there is no feeling of care from the staff. No have a nice day...not even a goodbye as we went out the door having been there for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: dobblesUsa
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was excellent. I have a mobility challenge so I was unable to go to the breakfeast room - they brought a breakfeast to me room each morning. When the elevator was down for a short period of time they helped me out. They also helped me with getting taxi's. They room I had was very clean. It had two twin beds pushed together, a desk with chair, a cushion chair, sliding closet, two night stand with lamps, a stand to put your suitcase on and hooks to hang things on. The bathroom was handicap accessible. There is a bus line on the main street which is right around the corner. There are plenty of places to eat at near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location”
Reviews.Author: powderhound760
Reviews.Content: I will probably stay here again. The location was perfect. it was the cheapest on the street of nice hotels. There were coffee shops that epitomized the Rome experience and we walked everywhere. Note: Ladies, do not try to break in those new beautiful boots going out for dinner- you will get blisters and ruin the rest of your trip. Learn from my mistakes. But the shopping is wonderful, the food amazing and the sights, well, I can't say enough. This is where civilization started. Old and new mix with amazing ease and when you find a bartender who loves tourists, stay for a while. I LOVE Rome and can't wait to go back. Also, they have internet, free breakfast (soso and the coffee was terrible. see note about amazing coffee shop down the street. .90 euro for an espresso) and a nice back courtyard terrace where we brought wine, cheese, olives and prosciutto for a wonderful pre dinner snack. Love this place! I love Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean, cool rooms (in hot Rome), but the service...”
Reviews.Author: myounder
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, the hardwood floors of the rooms and the modern A/C. The thick windows and shutters also kept the rooms dark and quiet for sleeping. Negatives: the breakfast room was in a stuffy, windowless basement when on the main floor, an outside courtyard remained unused. Also, the WiFi was spotty and necessitated repeated trips to the front desk for codes that had short expiries. Finally, the desk staff really didn't care who you were or what your problem was. They weren't rude - just indifferent. The room and cleaning staff were nice. Overall, the location and price makes me recommend this place. But don't expect a cheery concierge or American-style "how can I help you today" attitude. Instead, it was more like "Yeah, what?".

Reviews.Title: “Competent, but bad location”
Reviews.Author: Penn_Student
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the lobby is well-decorated, the rooms have high ceilings. Our room had a balcony - the street was very quiet. HOWEVER, the location is really out of the way. We had to walk for about 10 minutes from the nearest metro stop. This may not sound like a lot, but when you are sightseeing the entire day in July and want to get a lot in, it's nice to be able to get home quickly to rest your feet. The staff is alright, but compared to the first Rome hotel we stayed in, really not helpful. We asked, for instance, where the nearest stop was for bus 40, the receptionist just shrugged and said he didn't know. While this cold service may be typical, we got great suggestions and help at other hotels. So, if you want a place to sleep and already have been to Rome, this hotel will provide a competent roof over your head.

Reviews.Title: “Good value / choice if you don't get your first pick”
Reviews.Author: ssimmer
Reviews.Content: Decent location near Terminus train station. Good overall hotel quality for somewhat old, very 3*. Service nothing special but not bad. Beds are average twins combined to doubles. Street is nice, some decent restaurants and a very nice bakery just around the corner. Decent value overall.

Reviews.Title: “No more Rome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alina80
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at this hotel, but when I arrived there the room was no available anymoore. I was told that because of electrical problems. I was offered the opportunity to stay with my colleague in the same room one night ( of two). I do not accepted, and the receptionist there was very surprised that I did not end even hurt. He doesn't understand why I do not accept without comment. I will not ever come to Rome, all Italians behave unprofessionally with tourists (with the transiting Roma), seem very busy, very mischievous and arogance. At restaurants around the hotel (St Flavia) not eating so well and the waiters have to be repeated several times command because they forgets. They are rude, because they have thousands of tourists so you don't matter anymore.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsChanChan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 15 minutes walking distance to the Rome Termini and about 15 minutes from the Spanish Steps. The hotel staff were okay and there are elevators and high ceilings. The bathrooms are good with hot water and good water pressure. The TVs have BBC and CNN. Breakfast was fairly basic with cereals, yogurts and a selection of breads. The hotel area is safe. WiFi internet is free which is great, but the connection is sometimes poor since there are so many people using it.

Reviews.Title: “One True Hotel Out of the many that Claim to be One in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TraveledK
Reviews.Content: I travel to Rome quite often and have stayed at many places in this area due to the proximity the train and centre. Out of the many Hotels that claim to be such, in this neighborhood, this is one maintains the standard of a fine Hotel. In service, rooms and price. Actually via Flavia is a better neighborhood than those across Via Septembre closer to the Termini station where it gets a little more hectic and noisy at night. Read trip advisor and switched from one of the typical small hotels nearby that were not much more than a hostel filled with students and party goers. If your a adult traveler and would prefer comfort matched with price this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Friendly Staff, Nice (and Small) Typical Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtsmith131
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel again recently after a long time. The hotel staff was very helpful and this was likely the high point of the stay. They offered recommendations for restaurants and activities, and were able to even provide discounts for nearby restaurants. The room was small but very clean; the bathroom was even smaller, but also clean. The hotel is not far from the station (but far enough away!), though it is a bit of a walk to major attractions (for instance, the first morning we walked to the zoo, and this took us 30 minutes on foot). There are many restaurants in the area, and you get the feeling that these restaurants are visited by locals more than tourists, which is nice. Bus stop is near, too. Overall a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Great last minute find; quiet, clean, comfortable, friendly, low-key, inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: indri500
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to find a room here at the last minute when we arrived in Rome in July during our honeymoon and all the places we'd wanted to stay at were booked. Medici was clean, fairly priced, the room was comfortable, the receptionist was friendly and helpful and it was just what we needed for a couple of days in Rome spent visiting museums. It was your basic European-travel hotel plus a little more. Not the most convenient location, but it was safe and quiet, non-touristy, and there were some excellent restaurants very close by. I'd definitely plan on a longer stay there when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyM3
Reviews.Content: Beautifully renovated, Old lift with grill closing. Not a large room, but cozy. Large bathroom with shower and bidet. Pleasing enclosed patio. Included a excellent full, self-serve, breakfast (all you can eat).

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: sage09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in September before meeting some friends who were arriving the following day. It was about a 10 minute walk from Termini down a quiet street, Via Flavia. No problems - room was clean, basic (as are 90% of hotel rooms in Rome). Breakfast was good too and the lobby area is very comfortable with several comfortable couches. Some folk were using laptops so there is possibly wireless available. There seemed to be one desktop terminal also.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel however very far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: PrincessofNile
Reviews.Content: Its a beautiful hotel, rooms are tidy and comfortable ,but the location of this hotel was far away from all the attractions, i had to take 3 transportation from spanish steps to reach the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice family location - 3 star”
Reviews.Author: puchuncavi
Reviews.Content: A truly 3 star property, but clean, good breakfast and nice staff. Very quiet side street. If you like to be close to the action, it is not the place for you. If you don't mind cabbing it, you will be fine. I can't say that I didn't enjoy my saty, but I can say I probably wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “For those who seek to travel Rome - Clean & quiet”
Reviews.Author: Redyoyo
Reviews.Content: We searched for hotel in Rome while cost and close to the center were on our minds when we found hotel Medici. The room was very nice, clean and very quiet one needless to say how important it is after a long day in the city. We got double bed room unfortunately to discover that it's two beds which were put together. The mattress was not so comfortable but hey what can you expect when taking 3 stars hotel.. Nevertheless I had great sleep. Breakfast was minimal- cereals, cheese, ham, croissant, small yummy bunnies, jam & honey, orange & pineapple juices and coffee. As a matter of fact you don't need more when you are in Rome. 5-7 minutes' walk to the Metro station and from there two stations (1 euro) and you are in the center, it's easy to walk to center (we did it) but it will take 15-20 m'. 10 minutes walk from Termini station which makes it very easy to find a bus from the center to hotel because most of the buses stop near the hotel. For those who seek to travel Rome and sightseeing I'd highly recommend the hotel for one who looks for relaxing & spending time at the hotel it won’t be my kind of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JosefMalta
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 nights stay in this nice and quite hotel in Via Flavia Roma near the Termini station but adequately far. Reception staff very good, polite and know English quite well. Clean with a daily change of towels and toiletries . Double room which we were allotted was rather small but had all amenities including A/C, phone, mini-bar, TV and digital safe deposit box. Adjoining bathroom also small but had everything working to satisfaction although the shower drain was slow. Continental buffet breakfast with juice, coffee or tea, warm milk, bread rolls and toast, ham and cheese slices, jam and butter, two types of cereals and four different types of croissants. Situated in a quite area nor far from a major bus stop in Via XX Settembre which has routes to all major points of interest. Taxi always arrived in a couple of minutes. Good restaurants in the vicinity where the clientele is most local. Although a bit expensive considering that it is a 3 star hotel we have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very clean, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cardiffsuki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome for the 6 Nations rugby match Wales v Italy, this hotel is not as central as I had thought, although it is in a very nice area, Via Flavia. There are lots of restaurants and a good deli nearby. The hotel staff are warm and friendly, the only thing I would say, they close the bar at 10.30pm, how early is that!! Beware the food prices in Rome are really really high. The hotel provides breakfast, which if you like ham and cheese is ok , although the rolls ran out on the last day(5day)stay. The room was a good size and overlooked the small courtyard garden, the bathroom was very big and the shower etc , all up to expectations with clean towels every day. All in all a good hotel for the price we paid for 5 days, but they need to address the bar situation all we wanted was a social drink after we returned from our meal at 10pm, and we often had to wait for someone to come and serve us, but apart from that I would recommend this hotel, also I must mention it had the hardest mattress I have ever slept on, resulting in a really bad back for the 5 days of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ianilu
Reviews.Content: We ve just return from rome- stayed 5 nights at hotel medici -very nice place-we had a pleasant stay.the room vas large-clean and well equipped.the staff very helpfull and polite.breakfast very good with a lot of choices.the hotel is about 15 minutes walk from termini station or 2 stations by bus- number 38 or 86-on via piave-just around the corner.the street is busy in the day and quiet in the evening -a lot of ministeries and embassies in the neighbourhood. a lot of restaurants and eating places-moderate prices.we reccommand the restarants il soriso and la loccanda del bocca and the gelateria just around the corner

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: knackeredtraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Medici and booked this hotel directly as it was much cheaper that way (80 + 90 euros for a Thursday and Friday). It is a pleasant hotel though the single beds are tiny, not 3ft wide as I expect a single to be. Room was dark due to what appears to be fixed shutters, which was a shame as it looked over the attractive patio garden. Staff were friendly and helpful and were happy to keep our luggage for a few hours after we checked out so we didn't have to lug it to the station. Breakfast was fine with lots to choose from if you enjoy cereals and sweet buns. There is a fabulous restaurant round the corner to the right of the hotel and across the street but pop in and book early.

Reviews.Title: “A good Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgelsis
Reviews.Content: A good central hotel,that you can see the Rome by walking or with a bus,underground etc

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Amicatua
Reviews.Content: Medici is a nice hotel with positive and helpful staff(we had good information and help in other ways too). We stayed fo 3 nights and have not much to complain about. The rooms were clean and fine. We had a nice breakfast with many sweet things(marmelades, juices and sweet bread). The only thing that we didn't like was noices from a restaurant at the other side of the street(but that is the way it is...i guess). Another restaurant nearby served great food(and a delicious panna cotta with berries). Christina

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Beautiful, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: vasutrip
Reviews.Content: on our family vacation to italy, we stayed at hotel medici after reading reviews from trip advisor. i must say we were quite happy with the rooms and the hotel. The complimentary breakfast had good variety. most important, it was centrally located and near all the major tourist attractions. it saves lot of time as well as money. i highly recommend this hotel for family vacation to rome.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brx
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the Hotel Medici and found it reasonably good. On arrival the concierge was pleasant and courteous, The room was a little disappointing in that it was darkish and hardly spacious but as Roman hotels go it was fine. It was clean and had a room safe and large bathroom. The breakfast was ok with ham, cheese cereals and juices. The bar was good with a nice outside lounge and the prices were the cheapest we experienced in Rome. The hotel is within 10 min walk to the main train station- Termini. I printed out a map using google maps which was handy. From termini you can get the hop-on-hop-off bus tour of Rome which was well worth the 16 euro price. In essence, a mid-range hotel in a good location for 150 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms at the Medici”
Reviews.Author: Erin0208
Reviews.Content: Although I read the reviews I felt this Hotel was not centrally located and was in fact quite a walk to most central attractions. I am usually happy with most hotel however I was disappointed in the size of the rooms which were miniscule and quite dark. Very different to the photos. On checking in I was given a key to a third floor room to which my elderly mother and I took our own bags into a very tiny lift to the room. You can imagine my surprise when I walked in to find peoples bags and belongings everywhere. No apologies and a room that was substandard was given. I had booked this hotel nearly nine months in advance so I was disappointed. All I can say is beware of photos. I would like to see the room on the website as they did not offer different levels of rooms. Wouldn't recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Medici”
Reviews.Author: shabnumm
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel! Though 3 star.. great service, great location and very nice staff. We were pleasantly suprised that the hotel was so nice. We could walk to the Termini and all the sites and sounds. The patio was great to sit and read at. Wine at the bar at night. And a good filling breakfast for the morning. I would highly suggest this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BOBGIR
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at the Hotel Medici and we had a wonderful time there. We arrived at the hotel at 11am and expected to have to wait to check in but the man on reception went out of his way to find a room that was ready and even took into account a room away from the road which was a request we had put in via the tour operator! The hotel was very well maintained and had a really nice feel. The lift is small but will accomodate 2 people with 2 case's easily. The room's are spacious and cleaned everyday, the towel's are changed everyday and the bed's are comfortable. We had a room facing onto the courtyard at the back of the hotel which was really quiet although the road infront of the hotel is very quiet by Rome standard's. Great hotel if you want to be near to the Termini but if you wish to visit many of the sight's and possibly nightlife near the Piazza Navona then it will be a short taxi ride and we didn't find this to be too much of a problem. Overall clean,comfortable hotel ,nice staff, good value and a good 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HackerPilk
Reviews.Content: Would heartily recommend hotel Medici. Stayed for 3 nights in a quad room containing 3 single and one sofa/bed. Spacious clean room with high ceilings and view onto street. Bathroom was clean and had everything you'd expect. Didn't need to ask for anything extra - ample towels, soap, etc. The elevator was compact but quaint, so grateful that our room was on the 1st floor and we could use the stairs. Plenty of restaurants nearby, although we only used one on the first night; the other days we ate whilst out. Lots of delis for groceries are also just down the street. Opted to walk to most sights in the city, so enjoyed two very long and tiring days. Used the metro (nearest station is around 10-15 mins walk from hotel) to visit Vatican City - a bargain 1 euro each ! Felt very safe walking the streets at night. The buffet continental breakfast (served 7-10am) suited us down to the ground and the friendly front-desk staff topped off a great stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: ajandres
Reviews.Content: Hotel Medici is decent. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The sitting room is really nice. There is an elevator. There are a few restaurants and a small grocery store just down the block. Very convenient for snacks, water, fruit, etc. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the nearest metro. This isn't too far, but kind of a pain after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel web site gave me the impression that the location was just minutes from Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The walk to these sites was at least 25 minutes. Again, not too bad when you're fresh, but at the end of the day it is a tiring walk. The breakfast was terrible. Not much variety and not very delicious. I don't drink coffee but the coffee drinkers in my family agreed it was the worst coffee ever. The bathrooms are TINY! So tiny you can't store your toiletries in the bathroom. There is no counter space at all. Our group booked three rooms for three days, and then two rooms a week later. All of the bathrooms in all rof our rooms were the same. Tiny and no counter space. This is especially true if are sharing your room with someone else. Also, the SHOWERS ARE MICROSCOPIC in size. You can't turn around, bend over, or raise your arms. I am 5'7" and I couldn't extend my elbows without hitting the walls or shower door. The laundry service is sketchy. Double check with the concierge before you give up a laundry bag.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brokes
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Medici with 2 friends in November and found it to be great value for money. The room was simple, clean and all that was needed, bathroom was a touch small but nothing out of the ordinary. Our friends room had a larger bathroom though which was much nicer. The service was very good and we were dealt with very quickly on arrival. The breakfasts in the morning were adequate and standard european fare, ham cheese cereals etc and was great to come down to early in the morning. As per the other reviews the Pizza Restaurant around the corner on via piave is absolutely fantastic and I would highly recommend. There is also another restaurant recommended by the staff which is just up the street which was very good as well. The location is very quiet and we found no problems with walking to all the major attractions although it is about 40 mins from the vatican museum back to the hotel. If you're not inclined to walking though, a taxi should take you to where you need to in no time at all. On the upside the train station is merely 5 mins away which will take you to Fiumicino. Unless you are loking to spend a lot of money I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DevonCoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room, bathroom and shower were excellent. The location was quiet with restaurants close by including an excellent pizza restaurant a short walk along the next street. The staff were very helpful and breakfast was good with choice of ham, cheese, yoghurt, cereals etc. We loved this hotel and Rome and we will be returning in the near future. However please take care on the metro/underground as I had my purse stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: leftfoot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Medici for 4 nights in October, and overall, enjoyed the stay. Obviously as with most hotels, there are good and not so good points. Firstly, the good points. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Bathroom in good working order, fresh towels every day. Breakfast was adequate for me personally (fresh bread, croissants, fruit, jams, yoghurt, ham, cheese etc), although it may not suit some people who prefer a fry up. The hotel staff were polite and friendly, and the front desk always seemed to be manned. The hotel is located in a very quiet street and outside noise was minimal, if non-existant. Onto the slightly negative points. Firstly, location. The hotel is quite a way from the main tourist attractions. We are not quick walkers, and it took us around 45 mins to get to the Colosseum and 25 mins to the Spanish Steps. The nearest tube stations are about 15-20 mins away. The room, although comfortable, was on the small side, as was the shower. The bed was absolutely rock-hard, but this didn't bother me personally. The hotel does not serve food after breakfast, and it does have a small bar, which serves wine, bottled beers, spirits, coffee etc. All in all, looking at the prices of other hotels in Rome, I believe this hotel to be good value for money. Finally a tip about getting to Ciampino Airport from the hotel. The hotel have 'negotiated' a rate with a taxi firm of 50Euros, which I thought was quite steep. We used the buses that run from Termini Station (6Euros each)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: pariscathy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and had a great room 114, big and nicely decorated. The noise of the arriving tourist in the terrace woke me up once, but you just call down stairs and everything is quite again. Very nice staff, and good value for money- it is hard to find a good hotel room in Rome for €130 in September that is not a dump, this is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Ummy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Medici - perfect for a few nights stay - spotlessly clean, lovely bathroom with excellent shower and loads of towels and washing stuff. Good air-conditioning which was so welcomed after the heat of August in Rome!!!! Ample breakfast to set you up for the day. Staff were very polite and helpful. Lovely little seating area just beyond the reception desk for a relaxing coffee and a good book. We had a lovely room overlooking the 2 little restaurants across the road. A quiet little road just off the main roads with easy access to all travel facilities. 10 mins walk to the main train and bus terminus - so extremely handy for visits to any other place in the city. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: iw23
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for $106 a night in the middle of July. I wasn't expecting much, but Medici offered great value. The room was very small, but clean, comfortable, and adequate for my needs - there internet in the lobby and ample lounging area downstairs. Located in a nice, quiet neighborhood with several cute restaurants nearby, but only 10-15 minutes walking distance from Termini and Repubblica metro stops. I don't eat much for breakfast so the free breakfast of juice, coffee, cereal, breads, yogurt, and ham were perfect (and saved me a few Euro each morning).

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Overbookings!”
Reviews.Author: macksennett
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel in January 2007 for a holiday long weekend in May 2007. Upon arrival we found 'there was a probem with our room' ie. overbooked. They transferred us to a worse Hotel around the corner. No apologies, no compensation, nothing! We were disgusted - every travellers worst fear - no room on arrival. Advise you to ring and confirm before arriving, and tell them you are still coming and not to let out your room. Spoilt the whole Rome experience for us. Debbie and Dereck, Herts, England 28th May 2007

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: USFlyerNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We are a middle aged New York couple visiting Italy mainly to see our daughter who is studying in Florence. My husband and I stayed at the Medici for three nights and chose this hotel based on reviews. This was our first trip to Rome and we found this hotel very comfortable and convenient. The underground A Line is about 6 American blocks from the Hotel. From here you can get to just about anywhere in Rome. We also were able to walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps from the Hotel which took about 25 minutes with several stops to read the map. Although the room was small, it was clean and the mattress was great, unlike the saggy one we had in the 4 Star we stayed in Florence!! I was impressed with the flat screen TV mounted on the wall and although we could only get CNN in English it was more than I expected. There was also plenty of hot water which I heard could be a problem in some hotels. Our room was on the street side which was a bit noisy with the window open, however, we were able to close the window and put on the air conditioner fan which solved the problem. The staff were very helpful, although the desk sometimes got busy with just one person working. The breakfast was not good at all,but it was enough to get us going early in the morning. Three days was just enough of that!! The neighbor was rather nice and we looked forward to returning to the hotel in the evening for a lite dinner and some much needed rest. There were several restaurantes in the neighborhood and one just across the street. I would definately recommend this hotel. Having access to a computer in the lounge was also a big plus as we were able to keep in touch with family at home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ANev
Reviews.Content: My two siblings and I stayed at this hotel during Holy Week this year and were extremely happy with the hotel! The staff were very helpful and even though we arrived earlier than check in they let us into the lobby, speeded up our room and gave us complimentary croissants and cappucinos, which i thought was a really nice touch!the man at the reception area that morning and actually all of the people we came across at the reception area during the course of our stay were very helpful and communicated well in English. They helped us book taxis and answered all of our questions as best as they could-plus there was free access to the internet which kept my brother suitably entertained at times! The location of the hotel is a little bit of a walk from the Termini, but I was actually glad of this as the area around the Termini wasn't overly inviting and I was glad we'd decided on a hotel further away from there! Our street was actually fairly quiet so we slept soundly at night! The Piazza d'Republika is located within close proximity to the hotel and it leads you onto the Via Nazionale which is a great starting point to quite alot of the sights and there is also a Metro stop at the Piazza too. A word of warning though-the machines only give back a max of €4 change so if you've got bigger notes you might want to grab some change so your transaction will go through. Overall our stay at Hotel Medici was a very pleasurable one-the bathroom was very pleasant and a welcome change from our previous hotel in Florence. The only drawback with our room was that three beds in it was quite a tight squeeze and such close proximity to siblings at times can be dangerous!!! I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, Great location, Wonderful for women travellers”
Reviews.Author: SwannTraveller
Reviews.Content: As two single female travellers, safety was a concern when we were in Rome. This hotel was wonderful, in an excellent location - close enough to Trevi station to be convenient, but in a very nice area of the city where we felt very safe. Stayed for three nights in late November 2006. When we arrived later than we intended, the desk clerk was extremely friendly and also upgraded us to one of the largest double rooms in the hotel - on the second floor in the corner. Lovely facilities, high ceilings, quiet, comfortable beds, gorgeous marble bathroom. Everything was spotless and beautifully decorated. We were especially impressed with the flat-screen TV and the English channels - MTV and CNN. Breakfast in the morning was good - both hot and cold options, meats, cheese, bread, cereal, juice... nicer than other European hotels we've stayed in. Overall, would definitely recommend it! Top end of its price range, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and friendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: Leahalbany
Reviews.Content: It is located in a quiet neighborhood. The public transportation is very easy to reach. The bus stop is about 300 yards from the hotel. There are several bus lines to go different directions of Rome. Especially, there is a bus that go directly to Vatican and the bus ride is about 35 minutes. I highly recommended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: MrsMac52
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, better than we had expected. Clean and well run, friendly staff. Excellent value for money - free internet access was appreciated. Breakfast was adequate. We found this a good base from which to walk to all attractions. Hotel organised transport for us from airport and back.

Reviews.Title: “Why Hotel Medici is a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a seven day stay at Hotel Medici located on Via Flavia. Besides being a fully adequate hotel with a friendly and very helpful staff the story of Medici is location. This neighborhood is full of wonderful ristorantes, and cafes and a 12 Euro taxi ride from all of ancient Roma. A few blocks away is the modern art gallery MACRO as well as the Termini and great shopping. The rooms are very well air conditioned; AC is not a priority in most of Rome. For the price I cannot think of an equivocal value in the West, remodeled in 1997 this location is very clean and well appointed. Rooms sizes vary greatly as we had multiple rooms for our party, the front desk will be happy to allow you to check out another room if the one you're assigned is not adequate, based of course on availability at that time The only caveat is that several rooms including singles, doubles, and triples have rather small, ‘phone booth’ showers. The service staff is professional and proactive offering attention to any need gladly. While there’s no breakfast meats or eggs the morning meal provided is very adequate. We paid 120 Euro per night and got much more than our monies worth, we were just down the street from rooms costing twice that, with the primary difference being a well marbled lobby. If this hotel price were a stock it’s a strong buy and undervalued. The best tip I can offer is that the cheapest bottled water on Via Flavia is at a market just across the street to your left as you exit the hotel, I cannot recall the name except that it had a black awning including the word ‘Cuisine’. A standard sized bottle of water was 0.55 cents Euro here, the same bottle ranged to 1.45 cents Euro on the same street, a full liter was 0.85 cents Euro. Bravo Hotel Medici.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: chrs4944
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay with my wife at Hotel Medici. Surprised at some of the adverse comments by some Tripadvisor members, but can understand others. We arrived to find the reception staff under a bit of pressure - however they managed to sort out the guests problems fairly quickly. We had a room on the 3rd floor at the front of the hotel - clean, reasonable size with an adequate shower/toilet. No problems there! The staff were, on the whole, efficient and friendly - anything we requested was attended to right away. The breakfasts were a slight letdown. No fresh cheeses or hams, and the rolls were about as large as a vol-au-vent - I suppose you get what you pay for. The only major problem we encountered was with a small proportion of the guests - a bunch of loud and drunken young male Americans, who rolled in at 4.00am, with no regard for any other guests - shouting and generally making a nuisance of themselves. Finally another guest, an Italian, took issue with them and reminded them that they were visitors to Europe, not a Barbarian horde - problem solved. All in all, the Hotel provided a good, value for money base in Rome, and we would have no hesitation in returning.
